trends: There have been 8 other sightings in Copperas Cove
There were no other sightings in Copperas Cove on or around June 26th 2009
divs: Sighting DetailsWitness's story in her words: To escape the noise while talking with my sis on my phone, I went outside, laid on the trampoline and as usual, looked at the stars. There were even more than usual. I usually check them every night, in hopes of seeing a shooting star or something unexplainable. While on the phone, what I thought was a stationary star suddenly began to float [for lack of a better word] across the sky. Over the next hour five more 'stars' did the same thing. One time a plane flew near as one was floating or gliding off. Three other stars just disappeared all together. I did see a shooting star..it was orangish and went down fast. Or maybe it was a meteor. Are there meteors that seem to be stars? Do they go so slow??? I have seen several meteor showers in my life. This was NOT like that. Only two of these 'stars' [at a time] flew in the same direction and I watched them until they glided out of view...I do have limited view... They were white like stars, small like stars and made no sound. Both planes I saw tonight made sound.
